ch.ecma.csta.routeing

Interface RouteingListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.EventListener
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RouteingAdapter

    public interface RouteingListener
extends java.util.EventListener
    Initiates an event monitor on a specified device's routing service requests/events.

    The supported CSTA requests(events) include:

    • RouteRegisterAbort
    • RouteRequest
    • RouteUsed
    • RouteEnd

    Note that not all of the parameters for any given event may be supported. In these cases, the event description will contain a table of the parameters that are supported.

    Java listeners are used to implement the CSTA concept called monitoring.

    Add a listener to a device using the MonitoringServices.addCallControlListener method. To learn more about using listeners with this API, see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.

    Version:
    6.1
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      void routeEnd(RouteEnd event)
      A callback function which is automatically invoked on a listener previously added during route registration when the routeEnd occurs on a routing device.

      A callback function which is automatically invoked on a listener previously added after route registration when the routeUsed occurs on a routing device.

    • Method Detail

      • routeRegisterAbort

        void routeRegisterAbort(RouteRegisterAbort event)
        A callback function which is automatically invoked on a listener previously added after route registration when the routeRegisterAbort occurs on the routing service.

        The routeRegisterAbort indicates that the TSAPI Service or switch aborted the routing registration session. See RouteRegisterAbort for more information.

        Example: 

         // the event contains the handle of the routing registration session
 String routeRegisterReqID = event.getRouteRegisterReqID();
      
 // remove the listener to the registration here
        Parameters:
        event - provides handle of the routing registration session

      • routeRequest

        void routeRequest(RouteRequest request)
        A callback function which is automatically invoked on a listener previously added after route registration when the routeRequest occurs on a routing device or devices of the sub-domain.

        The routeRequest indicates that the switch sends the request for a call arrived on a routing device from the routing server application. The application may have registered as the routing server for the routing device on the switch that is making the request, or it may have registered as the default routing server. The routing application typically uses the call-related inforamtion within RouteRequest and a database to determine the destination for the call. The routing server application responds to switch via a routeSelect that specifies a destination for the call or a routeEnd, if the application has no destination for the call. See RouteRequest for more information.

        Example: 

         // the RouteRequest contains the handle and call-related information
 String routeRegisterReqID = request.getRouteRegisterReqID();
 String crossRefID = request.getCrossRefIdentifier();
 DeviceID currDev = request.getCurrentRoute().getDeviceIdentifier();
 DeviceID callingDev = request.getCallingDevice().getDeviceIdentifier();
 RouteRequestPrivateData privData = (RouteRequestPrivateData)request.getExtensions().getSinglePrivateData(); 
 
 // database look up for destination
 DeviceID dest = findDestination(currDev, calingDev, privData,.....);
 
 RouteSelect select = new RouteSelect();
 select.setRouteRegisterReqID(routeRegisterReqID);
 select.setCrossRefIdentifier(crossRefID);
 select.setRouteSelected(dest);
 select.setOldSessionID(session);
 select.setRouteUsedReq(true); 
 routeSvcs.RouteSelect(select);
        Parameters:
        request - provides handle and call-related inforamtion about the call on the routing device

      • routeUsed

        void routeUsed(RouteUsed event)
        A callback function which is automatically invoked on a listener previously added after route registration when the routeUsed occurs on a routing device.

        The routeUsed indicates that the switch uses the event to provide a destination to the routing server application with the actual destination of a call for which the application previously sent a routeSelect containing a destination. The routing application will receive RouteUsed only RouteUsedReq was set to true in the previous routeSelect call. See RouteUsed for more information.

        Example: 

         // the event contains the handles
 String routeRegisterReqID = event.getRouteRegisterReqID();
 String crossRefID = event.getCrossRefIdentifier();
 // the routeUsed and destRoute parameters contain the same information 
 // specified in the routeSelected and destRoute parameters of the previous
 // routeSelect request of the call.
 DeviceID routeUsed = event.getRouteUsed().getDeviceIdentifier(); 
 DeviceID destRoute = event.getDestRoute().getExtension();             
 RouteUsedPrivateData privData = (RouteUsedPrivateData)event.getExtensions().getSinglePrivateData();
 DeviceID destRoute = privData.getDestRoute().getExtension();     
 DeviceID callingDev = event.getCallingDevice().getDeviceIdentifier(); 
 // validate and update database if needed
        Parameters:
        event - provides handle and call-related inforamtion about the destination of the call

      • routeEnd

        void routeEnd(RouteEnd event)
        A callback function which is automatically invoked on a listener previously added during route registration when the routeEnd occurs on a routing device.

        The routeEnd indicates that the switch terminates a routing dialog for a call to inform the routing server application of the outcome of the call routing. See RouteEnd for more information.

        Example: 

         // the event contains the handles
 String routeRegisterReqID = event.getRouteRegisterReqID();
 String crossRefID = event.getCrossRefIdentifier();     
 // contains the cause code for the reason why the switch is ending
 // the routing dialog.
 ErrorValue errorValue = event.getErrorValue(); 
 
 // validate and update database if needed
        Parameters:
        event - provides handle and error value of the previous routing
